review:
Para empezar, aviso de que esto es una primerísima primera impresión. Haré una reseña completa cuando lo termine. 

IMPORTANTE

Antes de cualquier cosa, informo de que hay una alpha disponible GRATIS para probar en la página oficial del juego, si os quedáis con dudas después de leer el análisis, o queréis sacar vuestras conclusiones, podéis probarla. 
https://demonpeak.itch.io/demonpeak

¿Qué es Demon Peak? 
La historia nos cuenta brevemente como el mundo ha sido invadida por demonios y criaturas malignas, todas salidas de la misma montaña: Demon Peak, donde todos los males se concentran. La humanidad es atacada constantemente; Incluso se dice que todo ser humano tiene su contrapartida demoníaca. 
Sabiendo esto, un número de valientes se adentra en la montaña para acabar con estos demonios. Tú eres uno de ellos. 

Y ya está, de momento no puedo contar nada más de la historia, pero realmente, para el tipo de juego que es y a lo que intenta recordarnos, no necesita mucho más. 

Recomiendo este juego por muchos motivos. El primero de ellos es su arte, el arte es muy agradable a la vista , y las animaciones son muy fluidas. Todo conecta como debería: los golpes de los enemigos, tus ataques, los arrojadizos...
Los escenarios también están bastante detallados, aunque la localización tampoco da para mucho (cuevas y demás).

El aspecto sonoro está bien cuidado, quizás el pequeño doblaje de los personajes sea un poco de bajo presupuesto, y suena algo mal, pero en cuanto a música y efectos está bastante conseguido. La música es bastante pegadiza y me recuerda bastante a la saga de Megaman ZX (de hecho, todo me recuerda a esa saga, no sé el porqué)

Jugablemente responde a la perfección. Permitidme que vuelva a compararlo con Megaman ZX o Castlevania Symphony of the Night, pero es que se parece mucho, en lo bueno y en lo malo. Es dificil, pero si dominas el esquive que tienes desde el comienzo del juego, los artefactos que consigues, y el golpear-huir, tendrás una experiencia muy divertida, y casi nunca vas a sentir que has perdido por algun truco sucio del juego. 

Lo he probado con mando de PS4 y con teclado: funciona bien con ambos, pero como es lógico, la posición de serie de las teclas es algo difícil de usar, pero es jugable de sobra. Con mando es muchisimo más asequible, claro está. 

El juego bebe de la cultura asiatica, me gusta especialmente la presencia de los gatos, en concreto, el gran gato que te protege y hace de punto de guardado. 

El último punto a favor es su precio. Por 4 euros, 3 de oferta, yo creo que es un MUY buen producto calidad-precio. Y no sé como de largo es, pero por el trabajo que tiene, ya me parece un buen precio. 


 [ + PROS +]

- Jugabilidad divertida.
- Música pegadiza.
- Gráficos bonitos. 
- Buen precio. 


 [ - CONTRAS  - ]

- Curva de dificultad complicada, como en todo este tipo de juegos. 
- El doblaje patina a veces.
- Controles confusos con teclado al principio.


TE GUSTARÁ SI TE GUSTÓ: 
- Megaman, especialmente ZX.
- Castlevania, cualquiera, pero especialmente las partes de espada en Symphony of the Night.
- Cualquier plataformero antiguo.


Preguntadme cualquier duda que tengáis
¡Un saludo!

review:
DEMON PEAK REVIEW



Having played around an hour and a half of DEMON PEAK I can tell I'm in for a real journey. If you're like me and have a taste for the nostalgic days of Castlevania, Mega Man, Metroid, with a hint of (NES)Ninja Gaiden thrown in for flavor, you're in for a treat. 

LEVEL DESIGN
Let me start the review by comlementing the art of the game - the levels are absolutely stunning with sprites you can tell were hand crafted with the utmost care. When I came upon an ancient ruin with a waterfall pouring over the delapitated stonework it nearly took my breath away. It's one thing to make a game that harkens back to the graphics of old, but to actually take those styles and vastly improve upon them creates a true work of art. The whole world makes me want to explore deeper into the darkness, with many different paths to take I feel like I'm constantly finding something new.

MUSIC
The music and sound effects are top of their class and blend perfectly with the world. It's hard to deside what my favorite song is so far, but I really love Rainy Ridge's theme - those horns are amazing and the whole song gets you pumped. I've found myself rushing to keep up with the tempo, dashing past enemies and closer to the next boss fight. 
Truely a perfect mix of old and new, hints of east asia, western riffs and european orchestras that blend together to form the sounds of the world around you. 

SOUND EFFECTS
You can tell each sound effect was built for a specific purpose, nothing feels repetitive or recycled - giving you audio cues as to what enemy you're up against. The sound of rushing waterfalls, growling demons, massive stomping bosses with hulking hammers the size of your entire body bring the chaotic and dangerous world around you to life.  Each action, each power or item, all seem to have their own sound to them creating a lot of diversity. Everything sounds so organic and real, in fact so real I wonder if they were hand sampled then digitized. 

GAMEPLAY
The game can be played at whatever pace you would like, but I for one see it as an excellent speed running candidate. The mechanics involved in dashing and jumping can become quite complex as you progress through the game. Perfect timing is important when dealing with multiple enemies while assending platforms, some with highly lethal ranged attakcs  others charging you with melee attacks, while also dodging spinning blades attached to some of the platforms. 
It all creates a pretty pulse punding experience and while at times I was having difficulty passing an area it was usually due to my own horrible timing and/or understanding of new/different enemies. Thankfully a save area is never TOO far away and I always found my way back into the fight quickly enough, but not so close as that I didn't feel rewarded for finding the next save zone.
That's something I noticed right off the bat over all, I feel rewarded for progressing in this game where other titles have lacked that same feeling for many years. I remember when games were difficult not for the sake of being difficult, they were challenging to give a sense of accoplishment once you had progressed past a hard boss/platforming area, found the next save, or held onto just enough health to get you there.

END THOUGHTS
DEMON PEAK is going to be quite a ride, I can tell. I'm not a skilled platformer these days, and haven't played a 2D side scroller very seriously in years, but this one has me pulled in and I'm loving it. From the absolutely amazing music and sound effects to the art and design of the levels, this game oozes passion from the developers. It all has a very unique but somehow familiar vibe to it that brings about the feeling of discovery as well as nosalgia. 

While I did find a few minor bugs through the hour and a half I played, I can see that the developers have put a lot of love and time into the game and are sticking with it by rolling out patches as quickly as possible. I've seen them personally address multiple issues people have had and have immence respect that - so many "AAA" games or even other indie titles hardly communicate with their community - especially when there is something wrong.  I have faith after theses initial hiccups it'll be smooth sailing from here on out.



PROS & CONS (TLDR)

Pro
(+)Soundtrack
(+)Sound FX
(+)Graphics
(+)Level Design
(+)Different bosses, powers to absorbe
(+)Pacing is as slow or fast as you like it, but excellent for speed runs
(+)Many different enemies
(+)Advanced movement mechanics
(+)Difficult with worth while rewards


Cons
(-)Some glitches, nothing major

review:
XBOX ONEコントローラーを使用。

[h1]良い点[/h1]

・キャラクター達のアートデザインは全体的にカッコいいものが多い。ピクセルアートが好きな方は気にいることだろう。主人公が日本の甲冑を装備しているのが特にお気に入り。彼のピクセルデザインは目を見張るものがある。

・BGMの出来が非常に良く、引き込まれる。種類が豊富で、エリアを進めて新しいBGMを聴くのが楽しみなってくる。

・主人公は最初、通常攻撃、ジャンプ、回避（ダッシュ）しかできないが、ステージを進むにつれ、サブウェポンを入手したり、新しい技を取得する。戦闘のメカニズムが面白く、取得した技を使用するのには格ゲーの様なコマンド入力をしなくてはいけないが、慣れるとこれが使い勝手が良くて面白い。回復系のアイテムもあり、購入したり、道中で入手できたりする。

・回避や技の使用には緑色のゲージ（所謂スタミナゲージ）を消費し、これを管理するのが重要で、後半に進むほど戦闘によい緊張感をもたらしてくれる。後半は使用可能な技が増え、ボス戦で使うことが多くなってくるからだ。勿論、プレイスタイルにも左右されるが。

・戦闘は主人公の技がある程度は揃ってからの方が面白い。特にボス戦や強力な敵との戦闘が。主人公のHPは簡単に尽きてしまうので、ヒット＆アウェイが基本になってくる。ただ、戦闘に関しては一部の敵は問題がある、こちらは下記の悪い点に書かせてもらう。

[h1]悪い点[/h1]

・キャラクターとステージのデザインが合わない。主人公がウイてしまうステージが多く、デザインの統一性がとられていない印象が強かった。個人的には特に主人公のデザインが好きだったので、余計目立った。

・一部「高難易度」の意味を勘違いした敵のデザイン。敵がむやみやたらに硬く（HPが高い）、こちらの操作ミス待ちという物が多い。慣れてしまうと完全に作業になってしまう。加えて、同じ行動パターンでデザインが違う敵も多い。勿論後半に出てくるものほどHPがさらに高くなっている。

・配信開始時点（2017年0７月0７日）では細かいバグだけではなく、進行不可になるバグ等もあり、デバッグ不足が目立つ。一番致命的だったのがセーブルームから抜けられなくなるバグだ。

[h1]総評[/h1]

少なくとも、このレビューを執筆している時点（2017年0７月08日）ではお勧めできない。購入を検討されている方は今後のアップデートでバグ等が改善されてからでも遅くないと思う。主人公のアクションのメカニズム自体はとても出来が良かったので、残念だ。

传火— —
新手村-The Heart：自来也处可以购买物品，大剑侠处可以学习技能。
新手村左上为暴雨山脉（Rainy Ridge），右上方为修道院（Monastery），右方为半人马巢穴（Centaur’s Lair），继续往右为奥术之塔（Arcane Tower）。
暴雨山脉可以获得水下呼吸和长枪投掷（←+→+轻攻击）。
暴雨山脉BOSS秽湖水怪(Monster of the Infested Lake)打法：先躲在最下面，不停跳跃查看BOSS状态，一旦他停下来开大，就跳上去磨死他，不能正面肛，被摸两下就挂。
奥术之塔可以获得2段跳和空中下落重攻击（可以破坏红色地板）。
奥术之塔BOSS半人马（Master of the Arcane Tower）打法：很简单的BOSS，注意躲避他的挥击，跳跃到他身后攻击即可。
修道院（Monastery）可以获得升龙拳（↓+↑+轻击）和升龙霸（↓+↑+重击，可以破坏红色地板）。
修道院有一处水中幻影墙壁，打开可以获得增加最大技能值。
修道院BOSS灾祸僧侣（Scourge of the Monastery）打法：主体是祭坛，灾祸僧侣会一直用AOE攻击你，躲开灾祸僧侣的技能，攻击祭坛，血量低可以杀死眼珠怪回血。
击杀前面3个BOSS后，前往新手村正上方挑战最终BOSS，需要用到2段跳和长枪投掷（插在墙上可以站立，详见三目童子）。
最终BOSS心魔（The Heart of Evil）打法：一阶段是个法师，会释放各种AOE，非常容易躲避，被近身攻击后会释放原力迸发。
2阶段变身为恶魔形态，更加容易打了，只需一直2段跳到他身后磨血即可，完全没威胁。
至此游戏结束，此后可以开启2周目。
已获得成就--
一命通关《Single Credit Clear》-Finish the game without dying
极速通关《Speed Demon》-Finish the game in 45 minutes or less

review:
I really wanted to like Demon Peak. The art looked amazing, and gameplay videos I saw looked promising. Unfortunately, there were too many issues to consider this a game worth purchasing.

The controls aren't tight, and I often had trouble making basic jumps I can easily make in other games.

Enemies are far too aggressive at the beginning of the game. There's one enemy that constantly chases you and lunges after you; I didn't even bother fighting it and just jumped over it or ran away. It's the beginning of the game, where players are just getting used to the controls and mechanics. They shouldn't be thrown in to the deep end that quickly.

The shield feels like it's supposed to combat the archer enemies, but it doesn't really do much to succeed in this. The dash feels pretty restricted as well.

The music felt unfitting to the game world.

Overall, I can not recommend this game in its current state. I hope that the developers take these criticisms into account to offer a higher quality experience in the future. I don't want to give up on Demon Peak, but I simply can't enjoy it as it currently is.

EDIT: I just want to make it clear, I'm open to changing this review entirely as the game is updated. I'll be following the game closely and noting what's improved with each patch, major or minor. The game will probably never fully suit my preferences, but that's not important. The most important metric in whether I recommend any game or not is if it's fun. If I can one day play Demon Peak and have a truly fun experience, perfect or not, I would be just as delighted to recommend it to others as I would be to play it myself.

review:
Alright, so my initial opinion on Demon Peak was little. First there was no game data in the installation, then a game breaking save bug, then a boss that was just totally broken. After all the crap I went through for buying this on release and 3 hours in game, I have some new opinions.

Let's start with the pros:

[list]
    [*]Very fun, challenging combat with a good selection of moves and items at your disposal.
    [*]Mostly well designed enemies that keep you on your toes and constantly changing your tactics.
    [*]A beautiful, varied game world with great pixel art and a whole lot of style.
    [*]Overall quite good level design with lots of secrets and interesting pathways.
    [*]Awesome soundtrack that at times reminds me of Castlevania's tunes.
    [*]Extremely helpful and quick responding devs that are dedicated to fixing any issues the game has.
    [*]Cats.
[/list]

Onto the cons:

[list]
    [*]Pretty damn steep learning curve that has you frustrated early on due to overly-aggressive enemies that do a ton of damage.
    [*]Some very situational items that you just kind of forget about at times
    [*]Somewhat iffy sound design. Some sounds are just badly made.
    [*]Sometimes overly confusing level layouts and long periods with no save points. (Could be a pro or con depending)
    [*]An overall lack of polish (due apparently to the devs having to rush the game per the publisher's orders). Not too severe, but you can definitely feel it from the raw platforming, the rough inputs for some moves, and the rather minor bugs, such as a few platforms being invisible, one (optional at this time) boss being basically broken, and just a general clunkiness to everything. Like I said, not that severe honestly.
    [*]Personal Con: A lack of weaponry. There's your basic sword, a hammer, a limited throwing axe and a boomerang ninja star. I personally would have liked to have another primary weapon or two. Though to be fair, there's a few moves that are sort of different weapons.
[/list]

Overall, for fans of pixel art games and metroidvanias, I'm going to say I recommend it fully. At $5.00, it's a very good purchase. It's only several hours long (depending) but it's generally a good time.
